item.title: Sharing knowledge in a remote team, across timezones
item.description: “True innovation comes an intersection of a cross-pollination of roles and ideas” - Sunil, ex-CTO@Buffer I’ve been working remotely at Buffer for 6 years now. As a software engineer, one of the critical skill I believe we should must have is being able to learn continuously. However, working in a fully distributed team, split accross 10+ timezones. I live in Asia (UTC +8) while most of my teammates live in the US or Europe.
item.author: (Eric Khun)

item.title: English to SQL: progess updates
item.description: English to SQL translation is getting better! Can you guess which of these queries to find the actor appearing in the most movies (in a fictional dataset) was written by a human, and which by machine?

item.title: Techniques for Difficult Team Members - dcaulfield
item.description: Leading a team is difficult – it’s why people love or hate the job. Where a team member incorporates themselves into the people and culture around them, the team lead drives that assimilation and culture. They must understand that each person has a different personality, and therefore each team culture is different. If this wasn’t …
item.author: (David Caulfield)

item.title: When you find out you’re the copycat
item.description: It was a rollercoaster of a week. It began when my side project, which I’d been quietly building for seven months, unexpectedly made it to the number two spot on Hacker News. It ended with me considering whether I should give up on the project completely.
item.author: (About Ben Birnbaum)

item.title: Hillsborough State Attorney’s Office tapped to prosecute worldwide “Bit-Con” hack of prominent Twitter users
item.description: Tampa, FL (July 31, 2020) — Hillsborough State Attorney Andrew Warren has filed 30 felony charges against a Tampa resident for scamming people across America, perpetrating the “Bit-Con” hack of prominent Twitter accounts including Bill Gates, Barack Obama, and Elon Musk on July 15, 2020. The Federal Bureau of Investigation and the U.S. Department […]

item.title: Spotify CEO Daniel Ek says working musicians may no longer be able to release music only “once every three to four years”
